data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step to getting back on a plane is to take 10 steps forward. The second step to get back on a plane is to take 9 steps left. The third step to get back on a plane is to take 10 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You don’t turn around completely on the journey. You return to the starting point the same way you came. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 10 steps and you’re back at the starting point with 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To complete this process you first need to take the 7 steps. Then you take the first step to complete the 7 steps. If you change your mind take the next step. If you changed your mind take 7 steps and then 9 steps. There are 4 steps in each of the 7 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You have to backtrack to the starting point after returning from the opposite direction. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot return to the starting point if you were to turn left and turn right. If you are following the directions outlined below, then you could not. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right on left lane. Turn right around turn left. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Don’ t take six steps and not turn around. Take 8 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

It is always a good idea to keep your attention forward to avoid becoming distracted while moving. When you are facing forward, always keep your head upward and look in the direction you are moving. If you want to return to an original position, you need to face the starting point, otherwise you will return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around is one step. It is in reverse as turns. It is one step back as turns. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, your goal is to take 3 steps forward. If you always face forward, you should always take 1 step backward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you take 4 steps forward you come back to the starting point. When you take 6 steps backward, you go back to the starting point. If you take 8 steps right, you go back to the starting point. The first time you take 6 steps backward, you take 6 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In order to walk back, you first want to face forward. The first sequence that takes 3 steps left, takes you 9 steps left. The next sequence that takes 10 steps left, takes you 10 steps left, 3 steps left. Each is a step forward. The final sequence that takes 6 steps left, takes you 6 steps left. This is not a step backwards. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always face forward. You can return in one step from the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If there is one left arrow, the first right arrow is used. In order to correctly follow these instructions, the person must always face right. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you follow the directions below, you go north, right, and around. If you turn around, turn right again, go south, turn around, and turn around. If you continue the previous direction, it goes north, left, and turn around. If you repeat the previous direction, it goes northwest, then turn around, turn left again, and go south / east. If you repeat the previous direction, it goes south, then turn around, and turn around. If you repeat the previous direction, it goes east, then turn around / back. If you repeat the previous direction, it goes west, left, and turn around / back. If you repeat the previous direction, it goes west, then turn around, turn around, turn around, and turn around / return.. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You only turn around once to take 9 steps. So you take 1 round around time. So yes you can return to the starting point. So in the answer choices: Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 9 steps. So if you take 9 steps, you return back to the starting point. The answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 2 steps, you are then back at the starting point. When we take 7 steps, we are back at the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you turn right one can take only one step, and 7 steps are a multiple of 5. You cant take 7 steps and still take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you turn left, you take 1 step, 3 steps, then 3 more, 2 steps, and 6 steps to return the the starting place. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You are going back the same way you came. You cannot walk through a circle and walk back the same way you came. The answers: No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 3 steps, you return to the starting point. If you take 7 steps, you turn right around and return to the starting point. If you take 10 steps and finish all of your steps, you return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

First you start down stairs. Throughout any given sequence you would always be facing forward. If you start down stairs you would always be facing backward. The first sequence would involve facing forward and staying there for 4 steps. The second sequence was a reverse of the first sequence. A reverse sequence involves facing backward and getting to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is facing forward. If you take 7 steps backward, you return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you turn around and take 4 steps back to the starting point, you are back at scratch. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One should always face forward to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

The starting point is the beginning to the destination point. Turn right 5 steps. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let’s say someone puts on a wheelchair and starts with a “L” then takes a “R” then is taken in an empty theater, “M” then sits on the steps and then “W” again. If you continue to move forward with the same steps you start from, you return to the beginning point. So, the answer is no.

Take 1 step back in to the starting point. Take 10 steps to go back in time. Take 3 steps to go back in time. So, the answer is No.

You always face forward. You never take more than 1 step backward. So, the answer is No.

To take five steps backward, one must take five steps backward. To take four steps backward, one must take four steps backward. The starting point is facing forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you'll always be facing forward. The initial direction of the directions will always be forward. The starting point (where forward steps are taken) is always the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you’ re facing forward, you would always be facing forward. Changing to face upwards would lead to the opposite direction. Shifting to face upwards would turn you in the opposite direction. Change to face upwards would lead to the opposite direction. Being in the opposite direction can make you walk back to where you started. All steps could go back to where you started. So, the answer is No.

You take 2 steps at the start while doing 4 more steps at the start. If you take 2 steps, you are done with your first 10 steps. If you take 8 steps, you are done with the first 8, and so on. You cannot come back to your starting point if you have been turned around 4 times. So, the answer is No.

We should always feel in favor and confident before moving forward. When you take a step backward, you are shifting a gear and are bouncing on the ground. So, the answer is yes.

Turning around is not exactly the same as turning immediately right. If you turn around after taking 10 steps, you do not turn in 10 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you will always look left. If you always face forward, take the same steps as the left and right groups of instructions. If you always face forward, take the same steps as the right and left groups of instructions. If you always face forward and have a head node for walking, you will always face forward and take 7 steps left. You cannot take 10 steps backward and return to the starting point. There are only two ways to go backward. Thus, the answer is No.

If you were always facing forward, you would go forward. If you were always facing backward, you would go backward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

These instructions always lead in the same direction. If you are going to take 10 steps backward, you should always face forward. If you are going to take 8 steps backward, you should always face backward. There are 6 numbers in these steps; from 0 to 1, from 1 to 3, from 2 to 4, and from 4 to 7. Thus, you can never return to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Since you always face forward, you will always be facing forward. You can have 7 steps backward, 10 steps right, and 4 steps forward. To have 1 step left, you must have 4 steps forward, and 2 steps forward. So, the answer is No.
